alert.note: Alert for Rota; Saipan; Tinian (Marianas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Surf Advisory issued October 14 at 4:07PM ChST until October 16 at 6:00AM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CHST MONDAY ALONG NORTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... ...HIGH RISK OF RIP CURRENTS THROUGH LATE SUNDAY NIGHT ALONG NORTH AND WEST FACING REEFS... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 7 to 10 feet in the surf zone. For the High Rip Current Risk, dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...Guam, Rota, Tinian and Saipan Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 6 AM ChST Monday. For the High Rip Current Risk, through late Sunday night. * IMPACTS...Dangerous swimming and surfing conditions and localized beach erosion. Rip currents can sweep even the best swimmers away from shore into deeper water.
info.instruction: Inexperienced swimmers should remain out of the water due to dangerous surf conditions. Swim near a lifeguard. If caught in a rip current, relax and float. Don`t swim against the current. If able, swim in a direction following the shoreline. If unable to escape, face the shore and call or wave for help.
